knowledge: Pontifical Swiss Guard . The Pontifical Swiss Guard (also "Papal Swiss Guard", or just "Swiss Guard"; Latin: "Pontificia Cohors Helvetica" or "Cohors Pedestris Helvetiorum a Sacra Custodia Pontificis"; ; ; )  is a small force maintained by the Holy See that is responsible for the safety of the Pope, including the security of the Apostolic Palace. The Swiss Guard serves as the "de facto" military of Vatican City. Established in 1506 under Pope Julius II, the Pontifical Swiss Guard is among the oldest military units in continuous operation.
